title: FPS Drops and Crashes after the Windows 10 Anniversary Update
body:
Hey ya'll, Digital Ram from PS Tech here. 


We've noticed a bump in issues relating to FPS drops and crashing on the loading screen, after Champ Select. This issue seems to be caused by a Windows 10 app called the **Game Bar**. This feature has been causing a plethora of issues in game and in Champ Select. If you are experiencing these issues after updating Windows 10, please follow the steps below:


**_NOTE: You will need to be logged into your Microsoft email account for this._**

Turn off the Game Bar in the Xbox app. You can do this by following these steps:

1. Open the Xbox app by going to the Search bar on the bottom left of the screen and typing "Xbox”
2. Click on the Settings (Gear) icon on the left.
3. Click on Game DVR at the top.
4. Click on the On/Off (switch) under "Record game clips and screenshots using Game DVR" to turn it off. (it should be gray and set to "Off")

If you are having trouble locating the Game DVR, this Ten Forums post has a visual [Step-by-Step guide](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) that will walk you through this. 

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us by [Submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Make sure to include logs gathered by our handy [Hextech Repair Tool.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool)

Thanks!
